name: Plentific
slogan: Simpler, smarter property repairs, maintenance and management
description:
Plentific is a purpose driven technology business. For 6 years, we've worked with tradespeople and property managers to transform their processes and the communities they serve. Our single, powerful platform connects property managers with local tradespeople for a range of repairs and maintenance jobs - ensuring outstanding service, operational superpowers and better decision making.  

Our platform and marketplace is currently in use by property managers across residential, commercial and social applications throughout the UK and Germany. That's over 120,000 properties (and counting). 

Visit plentific.com for more.

team.name: Cem Savas
team.bioHtml: CEO & Co-Founder at Plentific. Previously, founder JOSS Property (>25 prime London developments), Worked @HSBC @Nomura (M&A), @Whu MBA

team.name: Emre Kazan, PhD
team.bioHtml: Co-founder at Plentific.com. Previously, PE investor at AnaCap FP, M&A banker at Nomura and Morgan Stanley. PhD, Univ. of Michigan, PostDoc Univ. of Cambridge.

team.title: Head of Growth & Marketing
team.name: Jared Ruddy
team.bioHtml: Kiteboarder, food nerd, part-time manproject engineer. Love brand optimism & big ideas. Head of Growth @Plentific. Ride a skateboard I'm probably too old for.

jobs.title: Back-end Developer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a talented and experienced Python/Django developer to join our growing team.

Responsibilities:
- Work with product and management team to come up with roadmaps and execute them in time
- Evaluate and identify appropriate technologies to implement product features
- Ensure technical problems are resolved in a timely and cost-effective manner
- Work closely with the founders, designers and other staff on product development
- Provide help in recruitment and training efforts

Required Skills:
- Strong experience in web application development using Python, Django, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, Celery, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch
- Good understanding of the entire web stack
- Strong experience in relational and non-relational database design
- Equally comfortable with ORMs and SQL
- Experience in deployment automation (ideally Ansible)
- Experience in AWS ecosystem (ELB, EC2, S3) 
- Passion for writing clean, modular, well-commented, readable and reusable code
- Ability to think out of the box with a can-do attitude to get things done efficiently
- Excellent communication skills with ability to articulate technical concepts in plain English

Nice to have:

- Degree in computer science, engineering, physics, math or other field with strong software programming curriculum
- Web scraping and data analysis experience with Python tools (Scrapy, pandas, NumPy)
- Experience in data science

jobs.title: Business Development consultant
jobs.description:
We at Plentific are looking for an outstanding and outgoing Business Development Consultant to join our rapidly expanding team. 

Working in Business Development, you will be one of the main driving forces behind the B2B aspect of the company. As such, you will be handling a very important component of the Plentific team. For the role, you will need to be a proactive and driven individual with a desire to help build the business. 
Your role will include plenty of autonomy, therefore, we are looking for someone who has an entrepreneurial spirit. You will be liaising with a vast array of property professionals by phone and email, moreover, you will be the go to person should any of these professionals have any questions.

Therefore, you will have the chance to move upwards in the company in a short space of time based on your performance. For this role, you will have also a personal training manager who will guide you every step of the way. 
As such, although no experience is necessary, we would prefer those with some Telesales or Advertising Sales experience. We are looking for a diamond in the rough!

jobs.title: Chief Editor
jobs.description:
Plentific is an online marketplace that helps home buyers as well as homeowners find and hire the best professionals and tradesmen. Our platform also helps professionals and local tradesmen enhance their online presence via rich microsites and targeted digital marketing opportunities on both Plentific.com and other high-traffic partner websites. Via our access to a highly targeted audience, we generate high-quality customer leads to our panel members.

We are now looking for a hands-on Chief Editor who will oversee content generation at Plentific. 

Responsibilities
 - Create and maintain an editorial calendar
 - Write unique, relevant and detailed articles for the Plentific Academy and Blog
 - Write comprehensive guides and other educational content
 - Send out weekly newsletters to customers and professionals

Requirements
 - Degree in languages, journalism, communications or other relevant field
 - Minimum 3 years experience in an editorial capacity at a high-traffic UK website
 - Experience in managing in-house and external writers
 - Knowledge and experience in writing SEO compliant copy
 - Clean, logical and engaging writing style
 - Clinically detail oriented person with a good dose of perfectionism

What we offer:
 - A fast-paced yet fun office atmosphere
 - Possibly the best coffee in town
 - A highly multi-cultural team environment

If this sounds interesting and you have the chops, please send your CV and cover letter to jobs@plentific.com together with some writing samples.

jobs.title: Backend Engineer (Python)
jobs.description:
Plentific is one of the fastest-growing property technology companies in the UK, with offices in Germany and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making housing and property work better for everyone.

We empower landlords and property managers with a platform to manage their properties. We utilise great local trade talent to create more jobs, build community cohesion and provide better services than ever before.

Since our humble beginnings in 2013, we’ve achieved a lot at Plentific:

- We’re growing fast. We work with many of the biggest property providers in the UK.
- Dramatically improved outcomes for housing providers, speeding up service delivery fivefold and creating economic opportunities within their local communities.
- Set a new industry benchmark on responsive repairs by reducing typical time frames (20 days) to less than 4 days.
- Recognised as ‘Deal of the Year - Residential’ at the UK PropTech Awards 2018,
- Recognised as ‘Professional Services Partner’ at the UK Housing Awards 2019 and;
- Repairs and Maintenance Provider of the Year at the 24Housing Awards 2019. 
- Entered partnerships with social enterprises such as *Beam*, with whom we help co-fund training for homeless people into trades jobs, and thus rebuild their lives.

2019 was an exciting year for Plentific - we were celebrated as leaders of transformative change - not just in our sector - but across business in the UK (UKBA Business Change/Transformation winner). Following a major funding round, we’re now expanding into the wider professional/commercial real estate sector in Europe, with plans to launch into the US multi-family market later this year.

We're a technology led business. We're proud to develop cutting-edge solutions for our customers, and that's only possible to do with a great team. Our culture is open. Empowering. Fast paced. If you're tenacious, passionate and driven, you'll fit right in.

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**The team:**

Headquartered in London, the engineering team is the connection between all teams at Plentific and is constantly tackling challenging problems, such as online payments, quoting, invoicing, booking, search / scoring algorithms, ETL, data pipelines, in-app messaging, real-time notifications and fraud prevention. Our backend engineers mostly work with Python and Django on an increasingly more service-oriented architecture. In the backend we also use Django REST Framework, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, AWS, Amazon Redshift, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis, Celery, Pandas, Numpy, Scrapy, Git with Zenhub, Jenkins, Elasticsearch, Logstash and lots of raw SQL for analytics. We have a very large but clean code base as we put significant emphasis on design patterns, code readability, testability, maintainability and extendability.

**The opportunity:**

We’re looking for an experienced Python/Django engineer to join the engineering team. You’ll be working alongside a highly technical and motivated team and report to the technical co-founder. You would be expected to apply fundamental engineering and mathematical skills to solve problems and overcome challenges, not just develop code. For people with the right mindset, this frame of mind provides an intellectually stimulating environment.

You will be working from our newly established Ankara office and be part of a distributed team of engineers working from the UK and Italy in addition to Turkey. There will be plenty of opportunities to travel and collaborate face to face.

**Responsibilities:**

- Work with product owners, product managers, user interface designers and other software engineers to write technical documents that identify software project requirements
- Write well-formulated, testable and readable code using appropriate software design patterns
- Design, build and maintain APIs, microservices and data pipelines
- Design, normalise and optimise relational databases
- Write complex SQL queries to get data from the database
- Optimise APIs and database queries to improve speed of execution
- Participate in code reviews
- Debug and fix bugs across our applications
- Review, maintain and refactor existing code to meet the requirements for improved or new features
- Write technical documentation of code, algorithms and APIs
- Help in drafting of end-user manuals

**Requirements**

- 1+ years software development experience using Python and Django
- Strong computer science fundamentals such as data structures, algorithms, discrete mathematics, software design patterns
- Experience in relational database management and SQL query optimisation
- Passion for writing clean, modular, well-commented, readable and reusable code
- Ability to think out of the box with a can-do attitude to get things done efficiently
- Excellent communication skills with ability to articulate technical concepts in plain English
- BSc (at least 2:1) essential in computer science, engineering, computational physics, mathematics or another field with strong computational curriculum. MSc/PhD in similar subjects desirable
- No military obligation for male candidates or postponed for at least 2 years

**Benefits**

- Competitive compensation package
- A new 15’’ MacBook pro and supporting hardware of your choice
- An annual learning and development fund

Please submit your CV in English

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer (Python)
jobs.description:
Plentific is one of the fastest-growing property technology companies in the UK, with offices in Germany and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making housing and property work better for everyone.

We empower landlords and property managers with a platform to manage their properties. We utilise great local trade talent to create more jobs, build community cohesion and provide better services than ever before.

Since our humble beginnings in 2013, we’ve achieved a lot at Plentific:

- We’re growing fast. We work with many of the biggest property providers in the UK.
- Dramatically improved outcomes for housing providers, speeding up service delivery fivefold and creating economic opportunities within their local communities.
- Set a new industry benchmark on responsive repairs by reducing typical time frames (20 days) to less than 4 days.
- Recognised as ‘Deal of the Year - Residential’ at the UK PropTech Awards 2018,
- Recognised as ‘Professional Services Partner’ at the UK Housing Awards 2019 and;
- Repairs and Maintenance Provider of the Year at the 24Housing Awards 2019. 
- Entered partnerships with social enterprises such as *Beam*, with whom we help co-fund training for homeless people into trades jobs, and thus rebuild their lives.

2019 was an exciting year for Plentific - we were celebrated as leaders of transformative change - not just in our sector - but across business in the UK (UKBA Business Change/Transformation winner). Following a major funding round, we’re now expanding into the wider professional/commercial real estate sector in Europe, with plans to launch into the US multi-family market later this year.

We're a technology led business. We're proud to develop cutting-edge solutions for our customers, and that's only possible to do with a great team. Our culture is open. Empowering. Fast paced. If you're tenacious, passionate and driven, you'll fit right in.

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**The team:**

The engineering team sits at the centre of everything we do at Plentific and is constantly tackling challenging problems, such as online payments, quoting, invoicing, booking, search / scoring algorithms, ETL, data pipelines, in-app messaging, real-time notifications and fraud prevention. Our backend engineers mostly work with Python and Django on an increasingly more service-oriented architecture. The rest of the tech stack include Django REST Framework, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, AWS, ES6, React.js, Alt.js, Node.js, Express, Amazon Redshift, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis, Celery, Pandas, Numpy, Scrapy, Git with Zenhub, Jenkins, Elasticsearch, Logstash and lots of raw SQL for analytics. We have a very large but clean code base as we put significant emphasis on design patterns, code readability, testability, maintainability and extendability.

**The opportunity:**

We’re looking for an experienced Python/Django engineer to join the engineering team. You’ll be working alongside a highly technical and motivated team and report to the technical co-founder. You would be expected to apply fundamental engineering and mathematical skills to solve problems and overcome challenges, not just develop code. For people with the right mindset, this frame of mind provides an intellectually stimulating environment.

**Responsibilities:**

- Work with product owners, product managers, user interface designers and other software engineers to write technical documents that identify software project requirements
- Write well-formulated, testable and readable code using appropriate software design patterns
- Design, build and maintain APIs, microservices and data pipelines
- Design, normalise and optimise relational databases
- Write complex SQL queries to get data from the database
- Optimise APIs and database queries to improve speed of execution
- Participate in code reviews
- Debug and fix bugs across our applications
- Review, maintain and refactor existing code to meet the requirements for improved or new features
- Write technical documentation of code, algorithms and APIs
- Help in drafting of end-user manuals

**Requirements**

- 5+ years experience (3+ years using Python and Django)
- Strong computer science fundamentals such as data structures, algorithms, discrete mathematics, software design patterns
- Experience in relational database management and SQL query optimisation
- Passion for writing clean, modular, well-commented, readable and reusable code
- Ability to think out of the box with a can-do attitude to get things done efficiently
- Excellent communication skills with ability to articulate technical concepts in plain English
- Experience in managing more junior team members
- Top academics (BSc, MSc or PhD) in computer science, engineering, computational physics, mathematics or another field with strong computational curriculum

**Benefits**

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:

- A competitive compensation package
- Private health care including discounted gym membership
- Learning and development fund
- A flexible working environment + 23 days annual holiday
- A head office in London Bridge (less than 2 mins from Borough Market)
- An inherently diverse culture with over 11 nationalities and 21 languages spoken 
- Food for thought: bottomless breakfast bar and drinks

[https://vimeo.com/303268493](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fvimeo.com%2F303268493)

[https://plentific.com/careers/](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fplentific.com%2Fcareers%2F)

- Strong computer science fundamentals and JavaScript design patterns
- 1+ year commercial React experience using one of the Flux frameworks
- Strong understanding of UI/UX best practices and considerations
- Passion for writing clean, modular, well-commented, readable and reusable code
- Ability to think out of the box with a can-do attitude to get things done efficiently
- Excellent communication skills with ability to articulate technical concepts in plain English
- Top academics (BSc, MSc) in computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics or another field with strong programming curriculum
- No military obligation for male candidates or postponed for at least 2 years

**Benefits**

- Competitive compensation package
- A new 15’’ MacBook pro and supporting hardware of your choice
- Annual learning and development fund

Please submit all CV's in English
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Plentific is one of the fastest-growing property technology companies in the UK, with offices in Germany and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making housing and property work better for everyone.

We empower landlords and property managers with a platform to manage their properties. We utilise great local trade talent to create more jobs, build community cohesion and provide better services than ever before.

Since our humble beginnings in 2013, we’ve achieved a lot at Plentific:

  • We’re growing fast. We work with many of the biggest property providers in the UK.
  • Dramatically improved outcomes for housing providers, speeding up service delivery fivefold and creating economic opportunities within their local communities.
  • Set a new industry benchmark on responsive repairs by reducing typical time frames (20 days) to less than 4 days.
  • Recognised as ‘Deal of the Year - Residential’ at the UK PropTech Awards 2018,
  • Recognised as ‘Professional Services Partner’ at the UK Housing Awards 2019 and;
  • Repairs and Maintenance Provider of the Year at the 24Housing Awards 2019.
  • Entered partnerships with social enterprises such as Beam, with whom we help co-fund training for homeless people into trades jobs, and thus rebuild their lives.

2019 was an exciting year for Plentific - we were celebrated as leaders of transformative change - not just in our sector - but across business in the UK (UKBA Business Change/Transformation winner). Following a major funding round, we’re now expanding into the wider professional/commercial real estate sector in Europe, with plans to launch into the US multi-family market later this year.

We're a technology led business. We're proud to develop cutting-edge solutions for our customers, and that's only possible to do with a great team. Our culture is open. Empowering. Fast paced. If you're tenacious, passionate and driven, you'll fit right in.

https://www.plentific.com/careers

The team:

Headquartered in London, the engineering team is the connection between all teams at Plentific and is constantly tackling challenging problems, such as online payments, quoting, invoicing, booking, search / scoring algorithms, ETL, data pipelines, in-app messaging, real-time notifications and fraud prevention. Our backend engineers mostly work with Python and Django on an increasingly more service-oriented architecture. In the backend we also use Django REST Framework, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, AWS, Amazon Redshift, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis, Celery, Pandas, Numpy, Scrapy, Git with Zenhub, Jenkins, Elasticsearch, Logstash and lots of raw SQL for analytics. We have a very large but clean code base as we put significant emphasis on design patterns, code readability, testability, maintainability and extendability.

The opportunity:

We’re looking for an experienced frontend engineer to join the engineering team. You’ll be working alongside a highly technical and motivated team and report to the technical co-founder. You would be expected to apply fundamental engineering and mathematical skills to solve problems and overcome challenges, not just develop code. For people with the right mindset, this frame of mind provides an intellectually stimulating environment.

You will be working from our newly established Ankara office and be part of a distributed team of engineers working from the UK and Italy in addition to Turkey. There will be plenty of opportunities to travel and collaborate face to face.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with product owners, product managers, user interface designers and other software engineers to write technical documents that identify software project requirements
  • Write well-formulated, testable and readable code using appropriate software design patterns
  • Diagnose and solve page load and other speed issues
  • Debug and fix bugs across our applications
  • Participate in code reviews
  • Review, maintain and refactor existing code to meet the requirements for improved or new features
  • Write technical documentation of code, algorithms and APIs
  • Help in drafting of end-user manuals
  • Identify, evaluate and communicate frontend best practices

Requirements

  • Expert level knowledge of JavaScript (ES6, TypeScript)
  • Strong computer science fundamentals and JavaScript design patterns
  • 1+ year commercial React experience using one of the Flux frameworks
  • Strong understanding of UI/UX best practices and considerations
  • Passion for writing clean, modular, well-commented, readable and reusable code
  • Ability to think out of the box with a can-do attitude to get things done efficiently
  • Excellent communication skills with ability to articulate technical concepts in plain English
  • Top academics (BSc, MSc) in computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics or another field with strong programming curriculum
  • No military obligation for male candidates or postponed for at least 2 years

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • A new 15’’ MacBook pro and supporting hardware of your choice
  • Annual learning and development fund

Please submit all CV's in English

jobs.title: Backend Engineer (Python)
jobs.description:
Plentific is one of the fastest-growing property technology companies in the UK, with offices in Germany and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making housing and property work better for everyone.

We empower landlords and property managers with a platform to manage their properties. We utilise great local trade talent to create more jobs, build community cohesion and provide better services than ever before.

- We’re growing fast. We work with many of the biggest property providers in the UK.
- Dramatically improved outcomes for housing providers, speeding up service delivery fivefold and creating economic opportunities within their local communities.
- Set a new industry benchmark on responsive repairs by reducing typical time frames (20 days) to less than 4 days.
- Recognised as ‘Deal of the Year - Residential’ at the UK PropTech Awards 2018,
- Recognised as ‘Professional Services Partner’ at the UK Housing Awards 2019 and;
- Repairs and Maintenance Provider of the Year at the 24Housing Awards 2019. 
- Entered partnerships with social enterprises such as *Beam*, with whom we help co-fund training for homeless people into trades jobs, and thus rebuild their lives.

2019 was an exciting year for Plentific - we were celebrated as leaders of transformative change - not just in our sector - but across business in the UK (UKBA Business Change/Transformation winner). Following a major funding round, we’re now expanding into the wider professional/commercial real estate sector in Europe, with plans to launch into the US multi-family market later this year.

We're a technology led business. We're proud to develop cutting-edge solutions for our customers, and that's only possible to do with a great team. Our culture is open. Empowering. Fast paced. If you're tenacious, passionate and driven, you'll fit right in.

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**The team:**

The engineering team sits at the centre of everything we do at Plentific and is constantly tackling challenging problems, such as online payments, quoting, invoicing, booking, search / scoring algorithms, ETL, data pipelines, in-app messaging, real-time notifications and fraud prevention. Our backend engineers mostly work with Python and Django on an increasingly more service-oriented architecture. The rest of the tech stack include Django REST Framework, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, AWS, ES6, React.js, Alt.js, Node.js, Express, Amazon Redshift, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis, Celery, Pandas, Numpy, Scrapy, Git with Zenhub, Jenkins, Elasticsearch, Logstash and lots of raw SQL for analytics. We have a very large but clean code base as we put significant emphasis on design patterns, code readability, testability, maintainability and extendability.

**The opportunity:**

We’re looking for an experienced Python/Django engineer to join the engineering team. You’ll be working alongside a highly technical and motivated team and report to the technical co-founder. You would be expected to apply fundamental engineering and mathematical skills to solve problems and overcome challenges, not just develop code. For people with the right mindset, this frame of mind provides an intellectually stimulating environment.

**Responsibilities:**

- Work with product owners, product managers, user interface designers and other software engineers to write technical documents that identify software project requirements
- Write well-formulated, testable and readable code using appropriate software design patterns
- Design, build and maintain APIs, microservices and data pipelines
- Design, normalise and optimise relational databases
- Write complex SQL queries to get data from the database
- Optimise APIs and database queries to improve speed of execution
- Participate in code reviews
- Debug and fix bugs across our applications
- Review, maintain and refactor existing code to meet the requirements for improved or new features
- Write technical documentation of code, algorithms and APIs
- Help in drafting of end-user manuals

**Requirements**

- 3+ years software development experience using Python and Django
- Strong computer science fundamentals such as data structures, algorithms, discrete mathematics, software design patterns
- Experience in relational database management and SQL query optimisation
- Passion for writing clean, modular, well-commented, readable and reusable code
- Ability to think out of the box with a can-do attitude to get things done efficiently
- Excellent communication skills with ability to articulate technical concepts in plain English
- BSc (at least 2:1) essential in computer science, engineering, computational physics, mathematics or another field with strong computational curriculum. MSc/PhD in similar subjects desirable

**Benefits**

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:

- A competitive compensation package
- Private health care including discounted gym membership
- Learning and development fund
- A flexible working environment + 23 days annual holiday
- A head office in London Bridge (less than 2 mins from Borough Market)
- An inherently diverse culture with over 11 nationalities and 21 languages spoken 
- Food for thought: bottomless breakfast bar and drinks

jobs.title: Business Development Manager (Berlin Based)
jobs.description:
*****German fluency and the right to work in Germany are mandatory requirements for this role*****

Plentific is one of the fastest-growing property technology companies in the UK, with offices in Germany and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making housing and property work better for everyone.

We empower landlords and property managers with a platform to manage their properties. We utilise great local trade talent to create more jobs, build community cohesion and provide better services than ever before.

Since our humble beginnings in 2013, we’ve achieved a lot at Plentific:

- We’re growing fast. We work with many of the biggest property providers in the UK.
- Dramatically improved outcomes for housing providers, speeding up service delivery fivefold and creating economic opportunities within their local communities.
- Set a new industry benchmark on responsive repairs by reducing typical time frames (20 days) to less than 4 days.
- Recognised as ‘Deal of the Year - Residential’ at the UK PropTech Awards 2018,
- Recognised as ‘Professional Services Partner’ at the UK Housing Awards 2019 and;
- Repairs and Maintenance Provider of the Year at the 24Housing Awards 2019. 
- Entered partnerships with social enterprises such as *Beam*, with whom we help co-fund training for homeless people into trades jobs, and thus rebuild their lives.

2019 has been an exciting year for Plentific - we’ve been celebrated as leaders of transformative change - not just in our sector - but across business in the UK (UKBA Business Change/ Transformation winner). Following a major funding round, we’re also expanding into the wider professional/commercial real estate sector in Europe - with plans to launch into the US multi-family market next year.

We're a technology led business. We're proud to develop cutting-edge solutions for our customers - and that's only possible to do with a great team. Our culture is open. Empowering. Fast paced. If you're tenacious, passionate and driven, you'll fit right in.

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**Requirements**

As the Key Account Manager for Germany you will be responsible for delivering the contractor base for the German market. You will be responsible for the smooth set-up and running of multiple channels within Germany to deliver a suitable market place and levels of service required to meet client expectations.

You will have a good and demonstrable knowledge of building sales channels, account management teams or managing call centres relationships to deliver required sales and meet company targets. Additionally, you will be a pro-active and organised person with great attention to detail. You will be fluent in both German and English.

**What you'll be doing:**

You will be responsible for setting up managing the supply chain within the German market which will include:

- Building and developing strong sales functions using a call centre within the contractor market
- Building and developing an Account Management function to provide first class management of the supply chain base
- Building, strengthening and growing key tradesmen relationships, partnering externally to ensure excellent service levels
- Recognising and actioning all customer queries, requests and issues, ensuring they are resolved to a high standard as quickly as possible through effective account management
- Taking responsibility for all job leads generated through our key partners via our platform and ensure 100% of their jobs are converted within the country (Germany)
- Managing and supporting the implementation and success of the country (Germany) sales strategy and business plans in conjunction with the UK Head of Supply Chain and other company stakeholders

**Skills and experience we'd love:**

- Fluent in both German and English
- Minimum 5 years-experience in a similar role
- Experience delivering supply chain market place within a similar industry
- Sales team success with contractors via the supply chain, online market place or lead generation industries
- Ability to scale and develop sales channels
- Experience in building high performing internal sales teams by territory, sector or vertical
- Good organisational skills, strong commercial awareness, drive, and great attention to detail
- Ability to deal with a customers and supplier base, understanding different cultures and working practices
- Work with a high degree of autonomy and cope well under pressure 
- Ability to manage competing priorities and changing objectives
- Strong stakeholder management and ability to work alongside peers/colleagues

**Benefits**

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:

- 26 days annual leave per calendar year plus all bank holidays
- Flexible work from home policy
- €250 learning and development fund
- €1,500 introducer bonus, if someone you introduce joins the company (plus we will donate €200 to the charity of your choice)
- Regular company-sponsored lunches, dinners and social gatherings

***We won't be accepting any applications via agency for this role***

Responsible for driving the efficient use of our CRM system (HubSpot) across the organisation. This would include identifying areas of opportunity, proposing new processes alongside reporting and implementing these.

- Improve data integrity

- Expert proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and Word

- Strong analytical skills and ability to problem solve
- Self-motivated and able to work with little direct supervision
- A team player with the ability to work effectively with a number of different functions, and with colleagues in different countries
- Strong written, verbal and analytical skills

- Repairs and Maintenance Provider of the Year at the 24Housing Awards 2019. 
- Entered partnerships with social enterprises such as *Beam*, with whom we help co-fund training for homeless people into trades jobs, and thus rebuild their lives.

2019 was an exciting year for Plentific - we were celebrated as leaders of transformative change - not just in our sector - but across business in the UK (UKBA Business Change/Transformation winner). Following a major funding round, we’re now expanding into the wider professional/commercial real estate sector in Europe, with plans to launch into the US multi-family market later this year.

We're a technology led business. We're proud to develop cutting-edge solutions for our customers, and that's only possible to do with a great team. Our culture is open. Empowering. Fast paced. If you're tenacious, passionate and driven, you'll fit right in.

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**The role**

We're looking for an experienced, detail-oriented and driven DevOps Engineer to join our engineering team and take on significant responsibility from day one. You will monitor site reliability, design new system architectures and maintain existing infrastructure. You will also be responsible for the maintenance and improvement of our CI/CD pipelines.

**The team:**

The engineering team sits at the centre of everything we do at Plentific and is constantly tackling challenging problems, such as online payments, quoting, invoicing, booking, search / scoring algorithms, ETL, data pipelines, in-app messaging, real-time notifications and fraud prevention. Our backend engineers mostly work with Python and Django on an increasingly more service-oriented architecture. The tech stack includes Django REST Framework, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, JavaScript (ES6, React.js, Alt.js, Node.js, Express), AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis, Celery, Pandas, Numpy, Scrapy, Git (with Zenhub), Jenkins, Elasticsearch, Logstash and lots of raw SQL for analytics. We have a very large and clean code base as we put significant emphasis on design patterns, code readability, testability, maintainability and extendability.

Responsibilities

- Improve and refine existing cloud infrastructure, based mainly on Kubernetes over AWS
- Champion and subsequently introduce new technologies 
- Work with QA and test automation engineers to develop and maintain a robust test infrastructure
- Design architectural solutions for product improvements and feature requests
- Design procedures for system troubleshooting, maintenance and logging
- Perform root cause analysis for production errors
- Help ensure the team continues to evolve and improve in everything we do, and how we do it
- Coach new joiners to grow a solid DevOps team

**Requirements**

- 5+ years of experience as a software and/or DevOps engineer
- Advanced knowledge of the AWS ecosystem
- Excellent understanding of security 
- Proven hands-on experience in Linux, Git, Docker and Kubernetes
- Working knowledge of Jenkins or an equivalent CI/CD tool
- Software development experience in Python a large advantage
- Excellent knowledge of networking protocols
- Ability to think out of the box with a can-do attitude 
- Excellent communication skills with ability to articulate technical concepts in plain English
- Passion for writing clean, modular, well-commented, readable and reusable code
- Excellent attention to detail with a strong sense of urgency
- BSc in computer science, engineering or another computational field

**Benefits**

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:

- A competitive compensation package
- Private health care including discounted gym membership
- Learning and development fund
- A flexible working environment + 23 days annual holiday
- A head office in London Bridge (less than 2 mins from Borough Market)
- An inherently diverse culture with over 11 nationalities and 21 languages spoken 
- Food for thought: bottomless breakfast bar and drinks

jobs.title: Frontend Engineer (React)
jobs.description:
Plentific is one of the fastest-growing property technology companies in the UK, with offices in Germany and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making housing and property work better for everyone.

We empower landlords and property managers with a platform to manage their properties. We utilise great local trade talent to create more jobs, build community cohesion and provide better services than ever before.

Since our humble beginnings in 2013, we’ve achieved a lot at Plentific:

- We’re growing fast. We work with many of the biggest property providers in the UK.
- Dramatically improved outcomes for housing providers, speeding up service delivery fivefold and creating economic opportunities within their local communities.
- Set a new industry benchmark on responsive repairs by reducing typical time frames (20 days) to less than 4 days.
- Recognised as ‘Deal of the Year - Residential’ at the UK PropTech Awards 2018,
- Recognised as ‘Professional Services Partner’ at the UK Housing Awards 2019 and;
- Repairs and Maintenance Provider of the Year at the 24Housing Awards 2019. 
- Entered partnerships with social enterprises such as *Beam*, with whom we help co-fund training for homeless people into trades jobs, and thus rebuild their lives.

2019 was an exciting year for Plentific - we were celebrated as leaders of transformative change - not just in our sector - but across business in the UK (UKBA Business Change/Transformation winner). Following a major funding round, we’re now expanding into the wider professional/commercial real estate sector in Europe, with plans to launch into the US multi-family market later this year.

We're a technology led business. We're proud to develop cutting-edge solutions for our customers, and that's only possible to do with a great team. Our culture is open. Empowering. Fast paced. If you're tenacious, passionate and driven, you'll fit right in.

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**The team:**

The engineering team sits at the centre of everything we do at Plentific and is constantly tackling challenging problems, such as online payments, quoting, invoicing, booking, search / scoring algorithms, ETL, data pipelines, in-app messaging, real-time notifications and fraud prevention. Our frontend engineers mostly work with JavaScript (ES6, React, TypeScript, Alt.js, Node.js, Express) on an increasingly more service-oriented architecture. The rest of the tech stack include Django REST Framework, PostgreSQL, PostGIS, AWS, Amazon Redshift, Kubernetes, Docker, Redis, Celery, Pandas, Numpy, Scrapy, Git with Zenhub, Jenkins, Elasticsearch, Logstash and lots of raw SQL for analytics. We have a very large but clean code base as we put significant emphasis on design patterns, code readability, testability, maintainability and extendability.

**The opportunity:**

We’re looking for an experienced frontend engineer to join the engineering team. You’ll be working alongside a highly technical and motivated team and report to the technical co-founder. You would be expected to apply fundamental engineering and mathematical skills to solve problems and overcome challenges, not just develop code. For people with the right mindset, this frame of mind provides an intellectually stimulating environment.

**Responsibilities:**

- Work with product owners, product managers, user interface designers and other software engineers to write technical documents that identify software project requirements
- Write well-formulated, testable and readable code using appropriate software design patterns
- Diagnose and solve page load and other speed issues
- Debug and fix bugs across our applications
- Participate in code reviews
- Review, maintain and refactor existing code to meet the requirements for improved or new features
- Write technical documentation of code, algorithms and APIs
- Help in drafting of end-user manuals
- Identify, evaluate and communicate frontend best practices

**Requirements**

- Expert level knowledge of JavaScript (ES6, TypeScript)
- Strong computer science fundamentals and JavaScript design patterns
- 3+ year commercial React experience using one of the Flux frameworks
- Strong understanding of UI/UX best practices and considerations
- Passion for writing clean, modular, well-commented, readable and reusable code
- Ability to think out of the box with a can-do attitude to get things done efficiently
- Excellent communication skills with ability to articulate technical concepts in plain English
- Top academics (BSc, MSc) in computer science, engineering, physics, mathematics or another field with strong programming curriculum

**Benefits**

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:

- A competitive compensation package
- Private health care including discounted gym membership
- Learning and development fund
- A flexible working environment + 23 days annual holiday
- A head office in London Bridge (less than 2 mins from Borough Market)
- An inherently diverse culture with over 11 nationalities and 21 languages spoken 
- Food for thought: bottomless breakfast bar and drinks

[https://vimeo.com/303268493](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fvimeo.com%2F303268493)

[https://plentific.com/careers/](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fplentific.com%2Fcareers%2F)

jobs.title: Mitarbeiter im Kundendienst (m/w/d) - Berlin
jobs.description:
Plentific ist eine der am schnellsten wachsenden Start-Ups in der Immobilien-Technologie Branche in Großbritannien, mit weiteren Standorten in Deutschland und der Türkei. Unsere Mission ist es, unseren Kunden das Verwalten von Immobilien zu vereinfachen.

 

Wir bieten Immobilienverwaltern einen Marktplatz, auf dem Sie die richtigen Fachleute für alle möglichen Arbeiten wie Reparaturen, Instandsetzungen und Renovierungen an Ihren Immobilien in nur wenigen Schritten finden.

Seit unseren bescheidenen Anfängen im Jahr 2013 haben wir bei Plentific viel erreicht:

- Wir wachsen schnell. Wir arbeiten mit vielen der größten Immobilienanbieter in Großbritannien zusammen.
- Dramatisch verbesserte Ergebnisse für Wohnungsanbieter, die die Bereitstellung von Dienstleistungen um das Fünffache beschleunigen und wirtschaftliche Chancen in ihren lokalen Gemeinden schaffen.
- Setzen Sie einen neuen Branchen Maßstab für reaktionsschnelle Reparaturen, indem Sie den typischen Zeitrahmen (20 Tage) auf weniger als 4 Tage reduzieren.
- Anerkannt als "Deal of the Year - Residential" bei den britischen PropTech Awards 2018
- Anerkannt als „Professional Services Partner“ bei den UK Housing Awards 2019 
- Reparatur- und Wartungsdienstleister des Jahres bei den 24Housing Awards 2019.

2019 war ein aufregendes Jahr für Plentific - wir wurden nicht nur in unserer Branche, sondern in ganz Großbritannien als Vorreiter des transformativen Wandels gefeiert (UKBA Business Change / Transformation Gewinner). Nach einer großen Finanzierungsrunde expandieren wir auch in den erweiterten professionellen / gewerblichen Immobiliensektor in Europa - mit dem Plan, im nächsten Jahr in den US-amerikanischen Markt einzusteigen.

Wir sind ein Technologieunternehmen. Wir sind stolz darauf, innovative Lösungen für unsere Kunden zu entwickeln - und das geht nur mit einem großartigen Team. Unsere Kultur ist offen. Befähigung. Schnelles Tempo. Wenn Sie hartnäckig, leidenschaftlich und motiviert sind, passen Sie genau dazu.

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**Requirements**

Wir suchen nach erfahrenen Mitarbeitern für unseren Kundendienst (m/w/d), die / der unser neues Team in Berlin verstärkt. Sie bearbeiten verschiedenste Kundenanfragen auf schnelle und professionelle Weise, basierend auf den KPIs unseres Geschäftes.

 

**Ihre Aufgaben**

- Verantwortlich für das Onboarding unserer Handwerker auf die Plentific Plattform.
- Organisation, Koordination und Verwaltung der Verifizierung und den dazugehörigen Dokumenten.
- Unterstützung bei dem Ausbau der Kundenbeziehungen mit Key Clients. 
- Bearbeitung von Kundenanfragen und Problemen mit dem Ziel der Lösungsfindung.
- Zusammenarbeit mit dem Senior Management zur Optimierung vorhandener und Entwicklung neuer Prozesse. 
- Inbound- und Outbound Interaktionen mit unseren Kunden durch Anrufe, Live Chat und E-Mails.
- Pflegen der Kundenbeziehungen durch proaktiv, positive und konstruktive Kommunikation.
- Formulierung von Feedback an die relevanten Abteilungen, um bei der Verbesserung der Kundenzufriedenheit zu unterstützen.
- Mithelfen bei der Bekanntmachung der Marke in Deutschland durch Unterstützung beim Training der Handwerker.
- Unterstützung bei Telefonkampagnen zum Onboarden neuer Handwerker.
 

**Ihr Profil**

- Hervorragende Umgangsformen am Telefon.
- Ausgeprägter Sinn für Kundendienst, sowie ausgezeichnete Fähigkeiten in der mündlichen und schriftlichen Kommunikation.
- Erfahrung im Umgang sowohl mit Kunden als auch Partnern aus verschiedenen (Arbeits-) Kulturen.
- Hohes Maß an Selbständigkeit und Belastbarkeit.
- Immer daran interessiert, das optimale Ergebnis für das Unternehmen, unsere Kunden und Partner zu erzielen
- Hervorragend in der Kommunikation in Deutsch (Muttersprache) und English 
- Mindestens zwei Jahre Erfahrung im Kundendienst von Vorteil
- Erfahrungen im Outbound / Telesales von Vorteil
- Hands-On-Mentalität und Flexibilität in einer sich ständig verändernden Umgebung
- In der Lage zu multi-tasken und bei vielen gleichzeitig anfallenden Aufgaben den Überblick zu behalten
- Abgerundet durch Organisationstalent, unternehmerisches Denken, Antrieb und Genauigkeit

**Benefits**

Wir haben richtig große Pläne! Unser Ziel ist es, unser Team von Denkern und Machern zu vergrößern, um unsere Vision zu verwirklichen: Wir wollen über 1 Millionen Immobilien in den verschiedensten Ländern über unsere Plattform managen. Werde ein wichtiger Teil von Plentific und gestalte mit uns die Zukunft des PropTechs!

Wir bieten:

- 26 Tage Jahresurlaub pro Kalenderjahr plus alle gesetzlichen Feiertage
- Flexibles Homeoffice
- Ein 250€ Fundus für Fortbildungen und Entwicklung
- Eine 1,500€ Prämie wenn Sie eine/n Bekannte/n mit zu uns an Bord bringen (Zusätzlich werden wir 200€ an eine Wohltätigkeitsorganisation Ihrer Wahl spenden)
- Reguläre Mittagessen, Abendessen und gesellschaftliche Events, die von der Firma gesponsert werden

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
Plentific is one of the fastest-growing property technology companies in the UK, with offices in Germany and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making housing and property work better for everyone.

We empower landlords and property managers with a platform to manage their properties. We utilise great local trade talent to create more jobs, build community cohesion and provide better services than ever before.

Since our humble beginnings in 2013, we’ve achieved a lot at Plentific:

- We’re growing fast. We work with many of the biggest property providers in the UK.
- Dramatically improved outcomes for housing providers, speeding up service delivery fivefold and creating economic opportunities within their local communities.
- Set a new industry benchmark on responsive repairs by reducing typical time frames (20 days) to less than 4 days.
- Recognised as ‘Deal of the Year - Residential’ at the UK PropTech Awards 2018,
- Recognised as ‘Professional Services Partner’ at the UK Housing Awards 2019 and;
- Repairs and Maintenance Provider of the Year at the 24Housing Awards 2019. 
- Entered partnerships with social enterprises such as *Beam*, with whom we help co-fund training for homeless people into trades jobs, and thus rebuild their lives.

2019 was an exciting year for Plentific - we were celebrated as leaders of transformative change - not just in our sector - but across business in the UK (UKBA Business Change/Transformation winner). Following a major funding round, we’re now expanding into the wider professional/commercial real estate sector in Europe, with plans to launch into the US multi-family market later this year.

We're a technology led business. We're proud to develop cutting-edge solutions for our customers, and that's only possible to do with a great team. Our culture is open. Empowering. Fast paced. If you're tenacious, passionate and driven, you'll fit right in.

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**Requirements**

The product team is composed of professionals who share a passion for building a world-class digital product. We enjoy designing and optimising user journeys and have an interest in colours, typography, iconography and other design geekiness

We’re looking for a talented team player with demonstrable experience of working as a Digital Product Manager. You’ll work alongside a highly technical and enthusiastic team and apply your product management skills across our B2C and B2B offerings.

**What you'll be doing:**

- Develop a deep understanding of our target users and their known and unknown needs.
- Negotiate product trade-offs impacting cost, schedule and usability to optimise ROI.
- Test hypothesis through surveys, interviews and user data.
- Write simple and high-impact consumer-facing copy customised to different customer segments.
- Work with product owners, product marketers, designers and software engineers to write detailed specifications that guide software project requirements.
- Manage internal and external communication of new product launches and feature releases.
- Turn ad-hoc and incomplete inputs, feedback and data points into actionable product insights.
- Provide regular updates and communicate project status, issues, dependencies and responsibilities to all stakeholders
- Oversee and develop more junior product managers and analysts.
- Proactively identify and manage key project risks, know when to escalate matters to senior management.

**Skills and experience we'd love:**

- BA/BS degree ideally in a numerical field
- 3+ years experience working as a Digital Product Manager
- Entrepreneurial, self-starter personality with a can-do attitude
- Ability to prioritise for business impact among competing needs
- Some experience in manual testing
- Proven experience in managing technical software products from conception to release
- Strong attention to detail
- Excellent written, spoken and presentation skills
- Hands on experience using spreadsheets and relevant software tools for product analytics
- Comfort in a face-paced, entrepreneurial, start-up environment

**Benefits**

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:

- A competitive compensation package
- Private health care including discounted gym membership
- Learning and development fund
- A flexible working environment + 23 days annual holiday
- A head office in London Bridge (less than 2 mins from Borough Market)
- An inherently diverse culture with over 11 nationalities and 21 languages spoken 
- Food for thought: bottomless breakfast bar and drinks

jobs.title: Senior Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Plentific is one of the fastest-growing property technology companies in the UK, with offices in Germany and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making housing and property work better for everyone.

We empower landlords and property managers with a platform to manage their properties. We utilise great local trade talent to create more jobs, build community cohesion and provide better services than ever before.

- Set a new industry benchmark on responsive repairs by reducing typical time frames (20 days) to less than 4 days.
- Recognised as ‘Deal of the Year - Residential’ at the UK PropTech Awards 2018,
- Recognised as ‘Professional Services Partner’ at the UK Housing Awards 2019 and;
- Repairs and Maintenance Provider of the Year at the 24Housing Awards 2019. 
- Entered partnerships with social enterprises such as *Beam*, with whom we help co-fund training for homeless people into trades jobs, and thus rebuild their lives.

2019 was an exciting year for Plentific - we’ve been celebrated as leaders of transformative change - not just in our sector - but across business in the UK (UKBA Business Change/ Transformation winner). Following a major funding round, we’re also expanding into the wider professional/commercial real estate sector in Europe - with plans to launch into the US multi-family market next year.

We're a technology led business. We're proud to develop cutting-edge solutions for our customers - and that's only possible to do with a great team. Our culture is open. Empowering. Fast paced. If you're tenacious, passionate and driven, you'll fit right in.

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**Requirements**

We’re seeking a senior digital-first marketer with big ambitions. If you live and breathe customer centred marketing, we want to hear from you.

We’re looking for a talented team player with demonstrable experience of working as a Digital Marketer at a senior level in a digital services company (marketplace experience is a plus). You’ll work alongside a highly technical and enthusiastic team and apply your Growth Marketing skills across our B2B offering.

Reporting into to the Head of Growth, it is a great opportunity to own and drive activity for a rapidly growing business. You will have the opportunity to lead in the development of activity across the full customer lifecycle.

**What you'll be doing:**

- Devising and delivering technical marketing campaigns across the B2B market - across a range of channels. 
- Managing campaigns from strategy to execution and measurement. 
- Managing all aspects of digital marketing acquisition: from PPC to SEM and SEO.
- Creating new digital assets : development of landing pages in conjunction with an agency, in line with acquisition targets. 
- Integrating campaigns across digital and offline channels - integrated wherever possible with Hubspot CRM. 
- Executing campaigns in-house; with freelance support and by briefing and closely managing a specialist and integrated agencies. 
- Developing the digital brand: expanding and optimising our website across international territories. 
- Collecting, analysing, reporting on marketing metrics.

**Skills and experience we'd love:**

- 5-7 years working in product marketing, growth, or similar strategic go-to-market experience.
- Proven experience within B2B marketing.
- Proven track record developing marketing plans with clear KPIs.
- Experience in campaign development, from research to messaging, positioning to content development.
- Experience in managing matrix teams, freelancers and agencies to deliver integrated marketing campaigns. 
- Building marketing funnels through bought, owned and earned channels, for inbound and outbound marketing activity.
- Developing integrated campaigns specifically for customer acquisition, with a particular focus on digital channels. 
- Developing customer engagement programmes for retention through partnerships. 
- Ability to write simple and high-impact consumer-facing copy customised to different customer segments
- Setting metrics and tracking and optimising marketing performance.
- Familiarity with marketing automation, CRM and sales automation tools (ideally Hubspot) for data driven campaign delivery. 
- Excellent written, spoken and presentation skills
- Strong spreadsheet modelling and analytical skills
- Comfortable in a face-paced, entrepreneurial, start-up environment

**Benefits**

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:

- A competitive compensation package
- Private health care including discounted gym membership
- Learning and development fund
- A flexible working environment + 23 days annual holiday
- A head office in London Bridge (less than 2 mins from Borough Market)
- An inherently diverse culture with over 11 nationalities and 21 languages spoken 
- Food for thought: bottomless breakfast bar and drinks

[https://vimeo.com/303268493](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fvimeo.com%2F303268493)

[https://www.plentific.com/careers](https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.plentific.com%2Fcareers)

**The Opportunity:**

We are seeking a new full-time digital designer to join our team. You will be designing a wide variety of things across digital and offline media both on the marketing side, and UI side with primary focus on the core product itself.

To be successful in this position, you'll be a self-starter, high energy, capable of delivering brilliant creative ideas, and show amazing attention to detail and willingness to learn new skills.

You will become a key part of an established design team mostly made up of senior professionals with plenty of opportunity for training and personal and professional growth.

**Responsibilities:**

- Plan concepts by studying relevant informations and materials.
- Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders as necessary depending on the scope of the project.
- Contribute to team efforts by accomplishing tasks as needed, in time eventually leading your own projects.
- Communicate with stakeholders about layout and design.
- Create a wide range of graphics and layouts for product illustrations, company logos, web pages UI and prototypes with software such as Sketch and InVision. 
- Review final layouts and suggesting improvements when necessary.

**Requirements**

- 1+ years of experience in the industry as a digital designer, preferably in startup or digital design agency
- Proficient with Sketch and inVision, basic experience in Abstract workflow, general proficiency with Adobe CC, Office, Google apps, Dropbox.
- High energy, happy to learn, positive attitude, passionate about design.
- A detailed portfolio showcasing your skills and previous work.
- Ability to create exceptional material from various information for a variety of uses.

**Benefits**

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:

- A competitive compensation package
- Private health care including discounted gym membership
- Learning and development fund
- A flexible working environment + 23 days annual holiday
- A head office in London Bridge (less than 2 mins from Borough Market)
- An inherently diverse culture with over 11 nationalities and 21 languages spoken
- Food for thought: bottomless breakfast bar and drinks

We are seeking a new full-time digital designer to join our team. You will be designing a wide variety of things across digital and offline media both on the marketing side, and UI side with primary focus on the core product itself.

To be successful in this position, you'll be a self-starter, high energy, capable of delivering brilliant creative ideas, and show amazing attention to detail and willingness to learn new skills.

You will become a key part of an established design team mostly made up of senior professionals with plenty of opportunity for training and personal and professional growth.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan concepts by studying relevant informations and materials.
  • Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders as necessary depending on the scope of the project.
  • Contribute to team efforts by accomplishing tasks as needed, in time eventually leading your own projects.
  • Communicate with stakeholders about layout and design.
  • Create a wide range of graphics and layouts for product illustrations, company logos, web pages UI and prototypes with software such as Sketch and InVision.
  • Review final layouts and suggesting improvements when necessary.

Requirements

  • 1+ years of experience in the industry as a digital designer, preferably in startup or digital design agency
  • Proficient with Sketch and inVision, basic experience in Abstract workflow, general proficiency with Adobe CC, Office, Google apps, Dropbox.
  • High energy, happy to learn, positive attitude, passionate about design.
  • A detailed portfolio showcasing your skills and previous work.
  • Ability to create exceptional material from various information for a variety of uses.

Benefits

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:

  • A competitive compensation package
  • Private health care including discounted gym membership
  • Learning and development fund
  • A flexible working environment + 23 days annual holiday
  • A head office in London Bridge (less than 2 mins from Borough Market)
  • An inherently diverse culture with over 11 nationalities and 21 languages spoken
  • Food for thought: bottomless breakfast bar and drinks
